climbs.name: Inspiration Day
climbs.fa: Bob Loomis, 4/18/2004, seconded by Kevin Klim

content.description: The crux is definitely down low moving over the first 3 bolts. Thin and technical face moves off of lots of side pulls to easier climbing up high.
Start in the right facing flakes (crux) behind the big tree and lieback until you reach the single bolt. Easy face climbing and navigating around moss leads to chain anchors.
content.protection: Large cam(s) (3-4") to protect the initial flakes. There is a single bolt after the flakes. Small gear (BD 0.5 and smaller) past the bolt.
content.location: Alpha Wall behind the big tree. To the right of A Climb Named Sue, and left of Inspiration Day.

content.description: The crux is at the 3rd bolt.  A little balancy getting through this area.  Runout at the top to the anchor (@20ft).
content.location: Left most bolted route on the Alpha Wall.

content.description: This is a good instruction route for teaching multipitch techniques to new climbers. a belay station is setup about 2/3rds the way up this route at a good stance. If you plan on doing this in one pitch make sure to bring long runners in order to reduce rope drag as this route wanders first left then right.
content.location: The right corner on Alpha Wall.

content.description: This route climbs the dihedral to the right of Courtney love. Start on the flake and lieback, fist jam, and grab big jugs to surmount the two small overhangs onto dirty ledges and finally the large ledge on top.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches with chain anchor on top.
content.location: The obvious dihedral in between Courtney love and a climb named sue.

content.description: An overbolted 5.8 route that is a good route for new leaders. The crux is at about the 5th bolt and lasts about 3 moves over slabby terrain. A good first lead route.
content.location: This is the first bolted route to the left of the large tree at the base of the Alpha Wall.
